Value: `X` component contains normalized expression data (cell x gene) in scipy.sparse.csr_matrix matrix format.
raw.X component contains a count matrix in scipy.sparse.csr_matrix matrix format.
Unique identifier corresponding to each individual cell.
Identifier for cell set computed from a clustering algorithm. Values are human readable names corresponding to IDs and additional information in the uns.

Column name in `obs` is the string [cellannotation_setname] and the values describe an annotation level of the taxonomy. Values are human-readable names corresponding to IDs and additional information in the uns.
This MUST be a CL term or 'CL:0000003' for native cell if unknown.
Identifier for the sequencing library for which molecular measurements from a specific set of cells is derived. From BKP.
Identifier for the unique individual; called `donor_label` in BKP.
Human-readable sequencing modality with a corresponding EFO ontology term. From BKP.
Most appropriate EFO ontology term for assay. (e.g., "10x 3' v2"="EFO:0009899", "10x 3' v3"="EFO:0009922", "Smart-seq"="EFO:0008930")
Species from which cells were collected.
NCBITaxon identifier; MUST be a child of NCBITaxon:33208.
Currently a free text field for defining the age of the donor.
Human-readable name for `anatomical_region_ontology_term_id`.
UBERON terms for `anatomical_region` field.
Brain region IDs from one of the brain-bican atlases for the `anatomical_region` field. Currently includes DHBA, HBA, and MBA, but will expand.
Placeholder for donor reported sex; aligns with BKP `donor_sex`. Use sentence case (e.g., "Female", "Male").
A child of PATO:0001894 for phenotypic sex or "unknown" if unavailable or if sex corresponds to something not included in PATO. Female = PATO_0000383 and Male = PATO_0000384.
Only relevant for human data. Any term corresponding to self-reported ethnicity.
Either the most relevant HANCESTRO term, "multiethnic" if more than one ethnicity is reported, or "unknown" if unavailable.
A term corresponding to disease state (or "control" for normal/healthy)
MUST be a MONDO term or 'PATO:0000461' for normal/healthy.
Either 'cell', 'nucleus', or 'na'.
True for canonical instance of cellular observation, False otherwise.
Human-readable SYMBOL term for gene features.
Gene ID from ensembl; must map to unique ensembl_id identifiers.
Logical vector indicating highly variable genes.
Logical vector indicating marker genes for multiple sets.
Full description of clustering parameters.
Description differentiating dataset from others in the same collection.
Link to molecular data if not present in X or raw.X.
Keys defining batches for normalization/integration algorithms.
Reference genome used to align molecular measurements.
Genome annotation version used during alignment.
JSON formatted dendrogram encoding taxonomy hierarchy.
Ordering of cluster_id and higher-level groupings.
Indicator of which taxonomy child to utilize.
List of booleans indicating cells for child taxonomy modes.
Marker gene expression for patchseq analysis.
Data.frame of cluster information.
Marker gene expression for taxonomy hierarchy.
Default embedding to display; matches a key in obsm.
Allen Institute Taxonomy schema version.
Dictionary storing annotation information
N-dimensional embedding (cell x dim) of high-dimensional data.
